definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: They exulted at the happy change.
sentences.chinese: 他们为这一可喜的变化感到兴高采烈。

sentences.english: Gratifying results were achieved in the studies of philosophy and other social sciences.
sentences.chinese: 哲学社会科学研究取得一批可喜成果。

sentences.english: Firstly with almond aroma, full with intense and lovely peach aroma.
sentences.chinese: 入口杏仁味和白桃果味丰厚，活泼可喜，酸度充足。

sentences.english: The burgeoning of India and China's economic ties is important and welcome.
sentences.chinese: 印中经贸往来的蓬勃发展是重要而可喜的。

sentences.english: But some map-based campaigns have already produced clear results.
sentences.chinese: 但一些使用地图的竞选活动已经取得了可喜的结果。

sentences.english: The birth of a live healthy baby is a truly blessed event.
sentences.chinese: 一个健康活泼的婴儿的出生真是一件可喜的事情。

sentences.english: Li Zhaoxing said that China-Russia relations have yielded pleasing results this year.
sentences.chinese: 李肇星表示，中俄关系今年又取得可喜成果。

sentences.english: China-EU economic and trade cooperation has yielded heartening fruits.
sentences.chinese: 中欧经济贸易合作取得了可喜的成果。

sentences.english: This paper takes large hydropower bases in South China as research cases and then gets some gratifying results.
sentences.chinese: 以南方三个大型水电基地为研究对象，得出可喜成果。

sentences.english: We would all like to congratulate you on your achievement.
sentences.chinese: 你表现出色，我们都觉得可喜可贺。

sentences.english: Divorce rates are also increasing, though they are still much lower than in America.
sentences.chinese: 离婚率也在上升，但还是美国老大更高，可喜可贺。

sentences.english: Heartening reports of victories are pouring in.
sentences.chinese: 可喜的胜利消息不断传来。

sentences.english: The party that is sponsored by teacher Tung this time ended successfully, congratulating .
sentences.chinese: 这次由董老师主办的导生会圆满落幕了，可贺可喜。

sentences.english: We have made excellent progress to date and will continue to do so.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经取得可喜的进步，并打算坚持下去。

sentences.english: These days, a 100-year run is quite thefeat, especially in technology.
sentences.chinese: 百年企业的确可喜可贺，特别是在科技领域。

sentences.english: This is our view -- a slowdown, sure, but one that it is to be welcomed from too fast a pace of growth, " said economists at UBS.
sentences.chinese: 在我们看来，这种过快的增长速度能够放缓是可喜的。

definition: to stand a good chance/to have great hopes/to be promising
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
everything is fine except for one small defect (idiom); the fly in the ointment
